soar.controller¶

soar.controller

class soar.controller.Controller(robot, brain, world=None, step_duration=0.1)¶

Bases: object

A class for interacting with simulated or real robots

Initialized by the client and used to call the user defined methods of the robot and brain

running¶

bool – Indicates whether the controller is currently running; i.e, repeatedly stepping

started¶

bool – Indicates whether the controller has been started

thread¶

Thread – The thread in which the controller is currently running

Parameters:
  • robot – An instance of a subclass of BaseRobot
  • brain – The currently loaded brain module, supporting the on_load(), on_start(), on_step(), on_stop(), and on_shutdown() methods
  • world – An instance of World or one of its subclasses. If this argument is omitted or None, the Controller will be interacting with a real robot
on_failure()¶

Called when the controller fails

on_load()¶

Called when the controller is loaded

on_shutdown()¶

Called when the controller is shut down

on_start()¶

Called when the controller is started/unpaused

on_step()¶

Called when the controller undergoes a single step

on_stop()¶

Called when the controller is stopped

protected_exc(*funcs)¶

Executes function(s) with protection, notifying the client of exceptions which occur

If a SoarIOError exception occurs during the execution of any function, print the exception’s content to stderr. This triggers a controller soft error, which necessitates reloading the brain and world

If any other exception occurs, print the full traceback to stderr, and signal a controller failure to the client

Parameters:*funcs – A variable length list of callables
exception soar.controller.SoarIOError¶

Bases: Exception

Raised whenever an error occurs communicating with a real robot
